titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alan Mara Bateman Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr.

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 09:58

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Correspondence, field reports, memoranda, and government documents chiefly relating to Bateman's service on various government commissions, among them the Metals and Minerals Division of the Foreign Economic Administration (1942-1946), the U.S. Missions to Mexico (1942), the President's Materials Policy Commission (1951-1953). The few items from his teaching career at Yale include gradebooks for the years 1907-1955 and reports on the Sheffield Scientific School.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alan Mara Bateman Papers (MS 641). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Yale Geology Department, 1960; Mrs. H. C. Carlisle, 1968; and Mrs. A. Bateman, 1972.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series: I. Correspondence. II. Topical files.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Alan M. Bateman: geologist; field geologist for Harvard University, 1913-1915; taught geology at Harvard, 1916-1925; taught at Yale University, 1925-1941, and chairman of the Geology Department; consultant to industry and government, 1941-1942; director of Metals and Minerals, Foreign Economic Administration, 1942-1946; consultant, 1946-; editor of several journals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, field reports, memoranda, and government documents chiefly relating to Bateman's service on various government commissions, among them the Metals and Minerals Division of the Foreign Economic Administration (1942-1946), the U.S. Missions to Mexico (1942), the President's Materials Policy Commission (1951-1953). The few items from his teaching career at Yale include gradebooks for the years 1907-1955 and reports on the Sheffield Scientific School.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.
